instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
threads.message:
Arrived without SSD showing up in disk utility and question mark folder. <CHIP>U8640</CHIP> was missing along with <RESISTOR>R8640</RESISTOR>. Replaced <CHIP>U8640</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R8640</RESISTOR> but still no SSD shows up.

Also tried known good SSD.

<CHIP>U8640</CHIP> area looks good. L8600/02 look good as well.

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S5G</SIGNAL> is 1.8V

What to try next??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
threads.message:
Replies from my post here have disappeared.

I know we left off to where I was getting proper voltages and resistance to ground was low on some components that needed to be.

What else should be checked?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
threads.message:
Looks like someone else messed up with SSD area before.
You must check all series caps from data lines and pull-up resistors.
Also check for broken traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
threads.message: <CHIP>U5420</CHIP> pin 6 is only 0.197V Is this correct?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
threads.message:
The voltage there is proportional with SSD consumption, sensed at <RESISTOR>R5420</RESISTOR>.
So yes, will be very low if SSD doesn't work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
threads.message:
Could this be bad CPU? <SIGNAL>SSD_BOOT_CONN_L</SIGNAL> starts at 1.8V then drops to .286V however <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN_CONN_L</SIGNAL> is 0V

<SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN_L</SIGNAL> is 0v and comes from the CPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
threads.message:
I think there are two kinds of SSD for this slot, but not compatible.
Did you try an SSD from same board model?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
threads.message: No we do not have a donar machine. Arrived with a 256GB 656-0067 C0882730 drive and trying to replace with a 128GB 656-0066a C0881870 drive.
